page.title: 06CUMBERNAULD- PLACE NAMES
page.content:
{CUMBERNAULD}comes from the Gaelic { {"CUMAR-NAN-ALT"}which means {"THE {MEETING OF THE WATERS"}The waters in question are the{LUGGIE WATER}and the{ {RED BURN}.The Luggie Water eventually flows into the R. Clyde and the Red Burn flows into the R. Forth.
{ABRONHILL}has three possible meanings- 1-Abraham's Hill 2-Hebron Hill- Hebron is a town mentioned in the Old Testament where refuge could be found from the authorities. 3-From the Covenanting times when people who supported the Covenant were forced to worship in remote places (ie) in the hills around Cumbernauld or Kilsyth.
